document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

43930C1CD7944B4B9E0239F3341E22F7.description:
Show awareness that we respect all
faiths because God loves all people.

58E5B0C661ED48FBA7E2485F6D7482D5.description:
Recognize different Christian and nonChristian
traditions.

4B5B6E5CA7D847588CF346780A485EE9.description:
Recognize that Baptism unites us with
those of other Christian faiths.

DB9A1F7C392C4AC0B9FB3DA542ABCD18.description:
Understand that God’s grace calls and
strengthens us to be disciples of Christ.

BB51AFDC589F49499D8AB6E458E19167.description:
Grow in understanding that the
Catholic Church works for the unity of all people to live in
peace and justice.

7062ED978DAA47B8927E50DF0C185013.description:
Understand that all people are made in
the image and likeness of God.

2CB251D7A82D4BF0BB406C88CA11BD4D.description:
CALL
TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044, 2472]

CB4DE66276AB4B67AE853E7CA61FF3E8.description:
Recognize each person has the
responsibility to share time, talents and treasure with their
parish church.

7A7AF91A7B3E4ADDA8D561731AAFC330.description:
Explain how the Church helps us realize
our unique purpose as part of God’s creation.

2CADF7B80E214C0B8B56CEC4578EFEA6.description:
Identify a steward as one who uses God’s
gifts with wisdom and love.

E44D157A60F0424F8A1C6A7AD3BA3EC0.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
social teaching about
the common good
[2149-2422]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3; 2:7-25

4CB52E5B84B444A889FB0DA964249AA1.description:
Explain how the Church helps them
realize their own purpose as part of God’s creation.

D1EA956216E34EA3AA8C36D780E38A7C.description:
Articulate ways to live as disciples in our
lives.

AC1EF4FAEA7443E7987952740E7F877D.description:
Understand that we are all called to be
disciples of Christ.

28DFCC0B56154B81AD91276B918743C3.description:
State the Church’s mission as given to
her by Jesus Christ.

2728327DBED94F17851D610731982244.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816,849]
Scripture:
Mt. 28:18-20

BBA2D7FDE97148F5B00C22E3849DDA8F.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6: THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

9550CB210F2642D691061B47A2D3DF9C.description:
Know the Rosary is a prayer to God the
Father through the intercession of Our Lady.

D248756950B7405D971D53873D7D1B3B.description: Celebrate days in honor of Mary.

D62AAFF88AE742268836434FA008BE37.description:
Recall various titles of Mary. (Resource:
Litany of Loreto).

D60C2D84E8EE413EB1B3A2DAA7C8EE29.description:
Articulate how the saints model the holiness
of the Church.

D6DA3212009246CEB66BD9615D50C7AE.description:
Review the names and stories of the Saints
whose images are represented in their parish church.

F787715F6BC044D493883DE709902344.description: Know the feast of the parish patron saint.

F0F69FCE129B42BD9289B0A7AD3D3EDA.description:
Recognize belonging to the Communion of
Saints in the Church.

BB1546989A804A5B96AD0C25D7E6C34C.description:
Show understanding that parents have a
vocation to serve God and the Church by helping their
children to grow close to God.

ABC556A9AE104865A0313878F12FC2D8.description:
Identify the four main vocational calls in
life: single, married, priests or consecrated religious.

5BC33447B0564DE0B0E9DD0B18D58482.description:
Understand that one’s vocation is
revealed through prayer.

9C4790C1A47A4E8A9D792F852EE22C67.description:
Know that all vocations are a gift from
God and each calls us to a particular way of holiness.

A67B2D4FD36649BDA996EE165909C669.description:
Vocation:
Marriage, priesthood
[914-933]
Scripture
1 Pet. 2:9
1 Sam. 3:1-10
Is. 6:1-8
Mt. 9:10:13
Mk. 1:16-20

59459109EC0D42E399A9C8ED1B6207B4.description:
Give examples of how to work for justice
and peace.

F06726158E774DC5A2AE6069A2935E65.description: Recognize the need to act responsibly.

E60FE6F1A8D94611843C801C60F833C5.description:
Articulate how practicing their Catholic faith
helps them to lead holy lives.

E86EDB0F34B34B3BAC06B96C04BDA021.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014,2028,2813]
Scripture
1 Pet. 1:15-16
Lev. 11:44

2947B03E3E8E4FACA636F3B1F565513D.description:
Identify ways that families live as a
domestic church.

750333CDE7664552B6C2397E69E4D44C.description:
Understand membership in the Catholic
Church, through Sacraments of Initiation, (Baptism,
Eucharist and Confirmation) and living lives of service as
disciples of Jesus.

1832A9AB1728409FA4228A3163C9E0FC.description:
Learn the Precepts of the Church as
Laws of Church and help us grow in love of others and
guide community.

6226B82EAEEE481A8B010DFC5C8FE8E2.description:
Understand the composition of the Church
today: family, parish, diocese, universal church,
communion of saints.

EB7DC6B57C26423D9E5A83E8A3D947AB.description:
Provide the name and role of the
Archbishop in the Archdiocese of Seattle.

2781AAF18EAB45E99CE71F2E06997140.description:
Identify the name of the current Holy
Father, Pope, and understand that he is the visible head
of the Catholic Church on earth.

1716820BF3F341C8818B45B40A5DF079.description:
Identify the college of bishops as the
successors to the Apostles through the laying on of
hands.

76CF11071FCF4B958C93DF73E68A5DB7.description:
Church
Order: The Hierarchy
and Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

C6A439A8842047A79D1D5E9262854182.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE:
[871-945]

3E3D6B608FA84EF58336B817A8084719.description:
List and explain the four Marks of the
Church: one, holy, catholic and apostolic.

7229A1719B0D444DA0A5CEA7BAEF7B20.description:
MYSTERY
AND MARKS OF THE
CHURCH: One, Holy,
Catholic and Apostolic
[811-870]

F3D33B1662BC43DDBD3C0717223CD43A.description:
Identify that God’s Holy Spirit lives in
me and inspires me to be holy as Jesus’ disciple.

7BDDA5252D3B44A8A17DD1785508F970.description:
Identify ways the Church is the Temple
of the Holy Spirit and is guided by the Holy Spirit.

3ED25B4FFFE54114861367648395AA5E.description:
Temple of
the Holy Spirit
[797-801]
Scripture:
1 Cor. 6:19-20

3C21066B6D2B4D12944BE0B5D4B52D46.description:
Engage with parish ministries that help
those in need, who are the hands and feet of Christ (i.e.
St. Vincent de Paul, funeral ministry, communion for the
homebound).

11084076FAB24AA6840E24F8FF7CD0C4.description:
Recognize that the parish is our
Church home where we celebrate Mass, participate in the
sacraments, and enjoy the companionship of other
believers.

0DBB3293F9B843B6B440DD2FF2CF7609.description:
Give examples of how they are learning
to express their faith within their parish community.

68E374B9BD0649D480FE316705F9FF29.description:
Articulate attitudes needed to live in a
community.

BE5AA2A9E63D4027B7DAAEE7EB685E00.description:
Identify how Christ is the Light of the
World and as members of the Body of Christ, we are
called to bring the light of Christ into the world.

9B1AEA185FCE41D49196A4FAE1C818B4.description:
Express how the gifts present in the
Church community reflect God’s love, goodness, and the
interdependency characterizing the People of God.

EEE7126C11434623A5392ECAFEF32FDD.description:
Recognize how Christ is the Light of
the World and through our baptism, we are all called to
bring the Light of Christ into the world.

FE0A1F7A3BF3481BA26AF9C1EFA764A9.description:
Articulate the different roles and
different ways of sharing the Gospel message in the
Church.

3F89C7D6864748258B5153F8EA086A17.description:
Understand that through our Baptism we
are all united in common as People of God.

FD3C43B4357B4253B2836CCA0D965C80.description:
Begin to understand Church as it refers to a
building, a community and individuals who serve God and
one another.

99243FE3223248878150E93D00D09FAF.description:
Identify important men and women in the
Early Church from the Acts of Apostles.

EC05316B61FF4AFD938228D7ADFBEC39.description:
Identify the birthday of the Church as the
Feast of Pentecost wherein Jesus Christ established the
Church and we are the body as His disciples today.

40BBB06403D5429F981D13C41D9F3A46.description:
THE CHURCH
IN GOD’S PLAN
[748-780]
Church History
[758-780
Scripture:
Acts 2:1-13

0D5AC807B1ED44D28CD0B795CEB9E9B0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5: THE LIFE, COMMUNITY AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of
Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

42FF56974C174B68B5DFE8BB67F05BFC.description: Agnus Dei / Behold the Lamb of God

4D462B20EC9E42259F23BEC4DABB9EFD.description:
Antiphonally psalms from the Liturgy of the
Hours – Psalm 67

9430347831814B2FA33052A4D32E65EE.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

CFF31E737B0D4B4D893F80791C80EBFE.description:
PRAYERS WE
KNOW BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

69FB5EF8068641838687CA7ADDD97893.description:
Experience a form of the Stations of the
Cross.

BC904DFC388D4650BE8F5804B52A41D5.description:
Know how to pray the Mysteries of the Rosary
and participate in praying the special prayer using beads
and praying about the mysteries of Jesus’ life.

A0B06996EBDC4FCEAE49145B7AC5381C.description:
Recognize the Rosary as a prayer to Our
Lady.

804D610D658641CA9C29012C7A696E2B.description: State that we pray with Mary and the saints.

64F505E69C5B4F9EA8F603ED2DD28E6B.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas)
[1200-1209, 1674-1679,
2683-2696]

8CC089C1913444B6B78A78C514142A37.description:
Recite the “Our Father” and identify the
requests we are making through the Lord’s Prayer.

EC7E56235DAB4CDBA418A50AA477F59F.description:
OUR FATHER:
Summary of the Gospel
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-13
Lk. 11:1-13

70A366843F6F4D19B751AAFBF9BA448C.description:
Read and reflect on a passage from sacred
Scripture.

9E9B9CF8ABE94C2F874015A99A7F9FE2.description:
Understand and experience adoration as an
expression of prayer.

2A08A1556E17425BA02DE0EE24ADA30C.description:
Differentiate between private and communal
prayer.

1512990FF1E448B58EE803A475017792.description:
Develop capacity of silence as a form of
listening to God within.

430415EA2E6249CAAF22997FA0680E94.description:
EXPRESSIONS
OF PRAYER (vocal
meditation,
contemplation,
personal and shared)
[2700-2724]

9A612074B2554AEEAA3EE960F34DB73C.description:
Show understanding of how use of Scripture
leads to prayer.

97829D1F49DF451FADC22219C23BFFF7.description:
Understand and write simple Prayers of the
Faithful asking God for needs in the Church, the world,
and their lives.

4A330F3163D54341B31FF46D6BB2F8B9.description:
Demonstrate ways to pray for the Holy Spirit’s
continued guidance of the Church.

70808DD8921441BB99077DAC032AB7F7.description:
Demonstrate ability to participate in various
forms of prayer with blessing, adoration, petition,
intercession, thanksgiving, praise.

5A0F774421FC4768AEFA5A4023B3EBE2.description:
FORMS OF
PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]
Scripture:
Psalms

8584FD7E20AF4CC8A07C3313F3B0E92A.description:
Demonstrate ways to pray for the Holy Spirit’s
continued guidance of the Church.

1ABCD878CFE045F1B56AC5472096B06A.description:
Explain why prayer is essential to our
Christian life with God.

B5C99D9ED91444629D9A1E541515D12C.description:
Experience prayer as a way to talk and listen
to God.

833C06EE0D614DF8B13C981E88C48B21.description:
THE UNIVERSAL
CALL TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

4EEC88D89D064F9B8B44E3EFF3ABB323.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

267090DA8DC54D759B12B4D54AA6AB76.description:
Participate in age-appropriate service
projects and share reflections on why service is part of
what it means to be “church”.

757C0FA1C2D64A64977852FE21B1270F.description:
Explain that the Church continues the work
of Christ on earth.

F3973238AC1747D9B10A8D4B994695BD.description:
Identify different types of work in a
community and that all work deserves respect.

A5EBD3F20997441B8C51803C0C2B617D.description:
Identify some causes for poverty and ways
in which we can help others.

463089A3122B4214AFBBB88A7B64236E.description:
Recognize that individuals and groups have
rights.

464A6D05CED946858E289DB618AC0663.description:
Demonstrate how families, schools,
parishes express responsibility for each other.

310D2ECA558842689473C7CEB2E993C2.description:
Practice care of personal belongings,
classrooms, school building, and parish grounds.

2D5F5339A9224B24B7EE46B01C1F8752.description:
Appreciate and respect creation as a gift
from God.

DF5BBC6B32424FA2B3206AC5C49BEF10.description:
Explain the call to community and the
common good as it is expressed in the Church’s Social
Teachings.

9F5FB271C3FC4C0CA24E8A724DE09591.description:
Catholic
Social Teachings –
Consistent Ethic of
Life, Love of Neighbor,
and the Corporal and
Spiritual Works of
Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

3EA70BFE49DD4A3EA9CF7C355CF60492.description:
Provide examples of how we forgive and
experience healing.

49C8DDBA8CDC4596B2DB539A6640A07D.description:
Exhibit understanding that we experience
God’s forgiveness when we are sorry for our sins.

2EB454C25B064DB3BA24F0517D9FAA37.description: Give examples of venial and mortal sins.

3191277028884E37A651B965C43D3F48.description:
Define sin as a decision we make to follow
our way and not God’s way and repentance as turning
back to God’s way.

A720A08467334E7E86019C0CF74BA929.description:
Personal and
Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25;3:1-24; 4:1-
16

7CCE313BF68A41FA8B5AE64ACEA256D3.description:
Demonstrate understanding that we are
responsible stewards of creation.

A7F60325A34745E3B1D2D218B1D10252.description:
Demonstrate awareness and show respect for
the community in which we live, a community of many
races and cultures.

0F3474590C014C0BB5383086B00581EE.description:
THE HUMAN
COMMUNITY
[1877-1948, 2204-2213]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25; 3:1-24
Lk. 15: 11-32

6E4C7E2AE38844DFAB34A950913689C7.description:
Describe how the Church helps them grow
in virtue and holiness.

E55E6A3BC5284660BE9B0811A4211545.description:
Recognize the Theological Virtues given at
Baptism: faith, hope and love.

C6076AF7BDE84EA48B815C5E52AFA903.description:
State meaning of virtue in relationship to the
Christian life.

AB5275885FB3494084E03096003AE2F2.description:
Virtues
Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture:
Col. 1:9-14
Ph. 4:4-9
Prov. 19:1

253C9AC82B1D40ECA446CADD800EE2F6.description:
Understand the Great Commandment of
Love given by Jesus is a guide for making good choices
and a summary of all commandments.

E41B5E2D0B994781A755BBEC6B3F48E9.description:
Explain how following God’s rules helps us
to be holy and happy.

3BD4CE443FE64025A4E67846E64AD010.description:
Demonstrate an understanding that the Ten
Commandments serve as a guide to living as disciples of
Jesus.

7AF455DAF2FC4DC99DF14811DE0CBAF1.description:
Recognize that the Ten Commandments as
a covenant with God’s people given by God to Moses.

FAF143BDD8CB47CE95B142B0B7C9999C.description: Know the Scripture story of God and Moses.

2B25225359AE4D60B46DCF724FA893E0.description:
Covenant and
Ten Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture:
Ex. 19: 16-20 – 20:17
Ex. 24:1-12
Mt: 22:34-40
Mk. 12:28-34

36E3BDDFF31C41D89D24C8F9A2C8F64C.description: Describe ways to form one’s conscience.

80598034BA134910B7B72E4C54534A6F.description:
Show understanding that God gives us a
free will so that we might freely love, honor, and obey
God.

B6D3655E90934978B77A85BF696BC163.description:
Describe how God gives us our feelings and
our imaginations to help us communicate, think, imagine
and choose.

0782704E46BA438EB9F101F046FF6C3D.description:
Explain how following God’s rules help us to
be happy, healthy, and holy.

4948A71B823F44A2A502A1E1651136D8.description: Read and find examples of the Beatitudes.

DF8BE0B11D0A473BA4BB0BE5102538B6.description:
Exhibit understanding that God created us
as naturally good destined for union with Him.

E1ECE5BCE8FC443A97981AC592E88B02.description:
Made for
Happiness with God,
Beatitudes
[1218-1229, 1716-1717]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-10
Prov. 3:21-35

E7E2B1CD282E41B9BC1BAA55AA043CE2.description:
Describe how God made our bodies as
sacred.

3A50215EA04E4EE6A015A81280F135FC.description:
Realize what it means to be made in God’s
image – body and immortal soul.

5B3C4FB7687A4AF888B462FA00854819.description:
Made in the
Image of God –
Foundation of Human
Dignity
[355-368, 1004, 1700-
1876]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19-20

4DD3B84848064018BEB5E2BC2DE793C9.description:
Understand that the Church offers us many
gifts in fulfilling our human desire to be close to God.

CD03A5DBEC0B49D680CBC8E1178E8507.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3 – MORALITY / LIFE IN CHRIST: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled
in a personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society

A5C2A56D415144EE8349CA0ABA1A97A7.description:
Recall that Christian funerals are a
celebration of our life in Christ.

31C7B925804D4E6585BCE96F0BFF9086.description:
Understand that Catholic marriage
(Holy Matrimony) is a sacrament that takes place
in a church and there are special blessings for the
couple.

BEED15BF805C4DA9A2489520A96D0857.description:
Liturgical Rites:
Weddings, [1621- 1637]
Funerals [988-1029, 1680-1690]
and Blessings [1671-1673

7555B6771A39462F8B6C5C89CA3E0E55.description:
Listen to and discuss the grade
level recommended psalms during prayer.

34F5DA8FBCCB472C84060381B6EB46E4.description:
With teacher and classmates,
antiphonally recite and pray Psalm 67.

180051C5403E40408D4CA3A1C2024F26.description:
Make the Sign of the Cross when
responding to the invitatory, “Lord open my lips”
with “And my mouth will proclaim your praise.”

DD338C7FEB35434B80DB6739420F56E2.description:
Recognize the Liturgy of the Hours
as the public prayer of the Church that is prayed
everyday across the earth.

6A661AAB0444476EA16007AAC27BC5BC.description:
Divine Office
Liturgy of the Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalms 23, 67 and 51

7D9665B53622431CB6FC93924CC0FBE1.description:
Name and recognize the symbolism
of the the different parts of the church: narthex,
nave, sacristy, sanctuary.

A3BC669170014EDAA2C03EE1E116209C.description:
View and explain the purpose of
different art forms found in the parish church: e.g.,
statues, baptismal font, Paschal Candle,
Tabernacle.

B287D95E2834433E8500FF59A21167D7.description:
State the meaning of a
sacramental, and how sacramentals can be
incorporated into daily life.

3DCAE199F12548D4B9920606A21D21C6.description:
Identify and differentiate among
Holy Days of Obligation, Solemnities, Feast
Days and Memorials in the Liturgical calendar.

24FE6800CCD34ED4A4E6FBB859C7A117.description:
Connect the Paschal Triduum, the
three day remembrance of Jesus’ passion, death
and resurrection, and the Paschal Mystery with
the ministry and life of Jesus.

51377DDDE7694E6D83CCB3CA00FC9A05.description:
Recognize the Holy Days of
Obligation in the United States.

ED3FE62287274142B8F4C2F320422C21.description:
Know that Advent is the beginning
of the Liturgical Year.

A65070AA655C461EAFC992DDF8266B1B.description:
Know and understand the seasons
and feasts of the Liturgical Year, their
significance, and the liturgical color.

B0F2914C32754C0DB944166659F917D3.description:
Recognize that some men are called
to serve the Church as ordained deacons,
priests, or bishops.

6DBC797A239B4A5F81760C9CF00E538B.description:
Understand that those who receive
the Sacraments in Service of Communion through
Marriage and Holy Orders help others through
serving and loving all people.

2A75935B53BF4C30AB05779CE0339777.description:
Sacraments at the
Service of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Ex. 19:16-20:17

6DE75967B8A940AF9684486C82C9E24B.description:
Know and articulate the effects,
symbols, the minister, and how the sacraments are
celebrated for those receiving the Sacraments of
Healing.

B437D9589F6F423995EA6AE4E9E28E6D.description:
Identify the process and the
importance of God’s healing in the Sacraments of
Healing: Reconciliation (Penance), and
Anointing of the Sick.

A502BDBDBB644AC5ACD23CE140F05269.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]]
Scripture:
Gen. 37:1-36; 45:1-28
Lk. 15:11-32

662C8E8460A74572981BB774D38E4025.description:
Connect the Blessed Sacrament with
Christ’s living presence under the forms of bread
and wine reserved in the tabernacle for adoration
or for the sick.

AB93C167A6884E2398F646EC36507E1A.description:
Identify the Sacrament of Eucharist
as the sacrament of Christ’s presence in the
Church.

F022795E900B4937819800AE0B3FAC45.description:
Develop an understanding of how
participation in the Eucharist builds up the Church,
the Body of Christ.

14AF5731521C48FEAC7B30631A760D97.description:
Define the effects (the change that is
the result of receiving the Sacraments) of the
Sacrament of Baptism.

1CEAC19669F44D479EAF7126F170A582.description:
Explain the meaning of “welcoming
and initiating” and why this is important in a
Eucharistic assembly.

9476A3E12BA5419CB2283092CE5DEE38.description:
Explain why we identify the Sacraments
of Baptism, Eucharist, and Confirmation as
“Sacraments of Initiation."

AB7B46600D1E4760B8FF11DBD4481F6D.description:
Sacraments of Initiation
[966-977, 1212-1419]
Scripture:
Ex. 19:16-20:17
Mt. 26:25-30; 27
Jn. 3:1-21

F4A3C161CCA34C2F8CFCEC46C91010F3.description:
Understand grace as the free and
undeserved gift God gives us to respond to our
vocation.

421A2D49EC0044638A7951408FA813FC.description:
Define Sacrament as an outward sign
instituted by Christ to give grace.

8D5275646BCC4067BDB6A21B583673F2.description:
CELEBRATION OF THE
SACRAMENTS
[1210-1666]
Scripture
Acts 15: 10-11
1 Cor. 15:10

28CC9753F25749F18E37CC1350FA9E3D.description:
With guidance from the teacher, as a
class, prepare a liturgy based on a chosen theme
or feast day. Include in the preparation: readings,
intercessory prayers and music.

D6EB9604A202442D80F15FC56D1DB7CE.description:
Describe the roles of the priest, deacon,
lector, ministers of Communion and acolytes in
the Mass

F40A89CAB7AA43318DD6A9B89F1D1887.description:
State that in the Concluding Rite we are
blessed and sent forth to serve others in the world.

9667656A292E4E62BD85D249E0240C86.description:
Introduce the term and concept of
transubstantiation and associate it with the Real
Presence of Christ in the Eucharist.

DA4570FB6E104270B768D7668C50D492.description:
Know that Christ is present in the mass
with the worshipping assembly, the priest, the
Word of God and most especially in the Eucharist.

48AF5141E3C041AEBF55823D63C4DDC7.description:
Understand the Holy Spirit is called upon
during Eucharistic Prayer to make the gifts and
the people holy.

C5905F0095CF4CE1AFAD1E6F44585BFE.description:
Understand the Liturgy of the Word
includes readings from the Old Testament, the
Responsorial Psalm, the Gospel from the New
Testament.

C217745D43D2476D828F2CB6A246D4A0.description:
State that during the Introductory Rite of
the Mass we ask for forgiveness and praise of God.

CFA292C9D5814A079F0FA57558974853.description:
Sequence the composition of the Liturgy:
Introductory Rites, Liturgy of the Word, Liturgy
of the Eucharist, Concluding Rite.

76C2DB1CE11E485EBA9ED1F2939211B0.description:
Understand that Sunday is the Lord’s Day,
the “Sabbath” and we participate in Mass to
worship, praise and thank God.

EB6F0764F822452EACE45B7C5436E9A2.description:
Exhibit understanding that liturgy as a
form of communal prayer in which we thank God,
and ask God for whatever we need.

AE99CB8CBCEB4DEB8B8B305B4905036C.description:
EUCHARIST
Who, How, When, and Where
the Mass is Celebrated
[1135-1167, 1322-1419]
Scripture
Ex. 16:1-35
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
1 Cor. 11:23-27

44B6E1C47DCF468B98EB0FFACD1F59AF.description:
Pray the Creed as a profession of our
Church beliefs.

CBCA53EA87534D91B929675640A72382.description:
Understand the promise of eternal life
after death as stated in the Creed.

DA73E060517F4DF1AA875B7492C7FEB9.description:
State understanding of, “I believe in
one God.”

BB0109BF222E47829BBD00F585C52984.description:
THE CREED, A
STATEMENT OF OUR BELIEF
[185-1065]
Scripture
Gen. 2:17
Rom. 6:23
2. Tim. 1:9-10

4B65429F2DB0441284CC407BD211670B.description:
Identify liturgical moments when we
reverence the Trinity (i.e. Holy Spirit called down
upon the gifts of bread and wine.

1B6CA9320365407D95C246A847F8F0EC.description:
Identify Christian symbols of the Holy
Spirit: fire; dove, and wind.

A1E595BF287C42649B99582680DC979E.description:
Know the Holy Spirit came upon the
apostles at Pentecost.

FC06DCE3B5164BC8B26FAC780202EC21.description:
Know the Holy Spirit is the Paraclete
(advocate or counselor) promised by Jesus.

07D15D723C5741789480D4F510BC3EF3.description:
Identify some characteristics of God: e.g.,
almighty, all knowing, all merciful, all just, all
present.

442532515F29402E88C679080EFE7EAE.description:
Identify the Holy Trinity in the Apostles
Creed.

712271E6AD614597ACD10B4CF5969A1A.description:
TRINITY:
GOD THE CREATOR,
JESUS THE REDEEMER, AND
HOLY SPIRIT AS SANCTIFIER
[249-324]
Scripture:
Gen. 1:20-31
Mt. 28:16-20
Mk. 1:9-11
Lk 3:21-22
Rom. 8:26-27

60B286A78C6E4A9786BBFBCDB8CFD80F.description:
Understand that the Paschal Mystery
relates to Jesus’ passion, death, Resurrection, and
Ascension.

1E25ABEBAFEE4DCC85F5C40259805B7F.description:
Know various names given to Jesus:
e.g. Savior, Redeemer, Son of God.

83288FF9C07E43519695E67F8389DB49.description:
Know the name Jesus means Savior,
Jesus died to save us.

A2C6703CD13F445BBD3F068A5435BC4F.description:
Know that Incarnation refers to God
entering our world with a human nature.

72B85BE80A4943429A36E3CE10BC909F.description:
Locate New Testament stories of the
teachings of Jesus Christ.

4EF6617D1E6A4309B5C4671307E9A088.description:
Articulate understanding that God the
Father sent God the Son, Jesus Christ as our
Redeemer.

A3F9B4DE6287443EA4CF72E26A7D61E9.description:
Identify sacred stories from the Bible
where God redeems his people.

F7757252092D46EF8096C40FDDA51820.description:
Listen to the stories of the early
Church in the Acts of the Apostles.

10AAFAF4181F4A76B8F75A88F916B6FA.description:
Describe New Testament books that
reveal the teachings of Jesus.

07D52A23EE4C4FB0B89F6E4C5174B352.description:
Describe Old Testament books that
reveal God as Creator and Protector.

8265FAEA36A04FB89B91C8C22EAD81DC.description:
Salvation History
[50-73]
Scripture:
Genesis
Exodus
John 3:16-18

519E2A6D70544F0F9645D1EC77B57BD5.description:
State that the Holy Spirit inspired
people to write the Bible. (See inspiration.)

4521C4F4890844A4859F3F96716CF222.description:
Articulate why the Bible is special to the
Church.

0CFB2DD796454212B198B8ABC7984B04.description:
Identify Scripture and Tradition as
ways God revealed Himself to us.

52A144D8C6314F39B254B9D438704325.description:
Articulate that God reveals Himself fully
by sending us his own Divine Son, Jesus Christ.

BE487F171B9846F29E5414C466558300.description:
Understand that God creates freely and
out of love.

0BCD2A79DD9E49DFB1932C7D30745FDB.description:
Know that Catholics learn about God
through both Scripture and Tradition.

A9D6923F97E74E8A89A569176C58DB9D.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1 – KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
